definition: to earn a living
(coll.) job/work
camp/barracks/battalion/to build/to operate/to manage/to strive for
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: They rely on police and media pressure to reform such businesses, he added.
sentences.chinese: 他们依靠警方和媒体压力来改革此类营生，他说。

sentences.english: While you preach peace, you make it the business of your life to stir up dissension.
sentences.chinese: 你一边宣传和平，一边又干着煽动纷争的营生。

sentences.english: She used the money to start a typewriting business.
sentences.chinese: 她用钱开始干打字的营生。

sentences.english: She used the money to start a typewriting business.
sentences.chinese: 她用这些钱开始干打字的营生。

sentences.english: So he chose to work as a craftsman to support his family.
sentences.chinese: 所以他选择做手艺活支撑家庭营生。

sentences.english: And actually, what Gelute and its colleague do so is the livelihood of poacher.
sentences.chinese: 而实际上，格鲁特及其同僚原来做的是偷猎者的营生。

sentences.english: When people ask me what I do for a living, I don’t really know what to say.
sentences.chinese: 当人们问我我做何营生，我真不知道说什么。

sentences.english: Bai, really I shouldn’t say, but selling drugs is a nasty business.
sentences.chinese: 巴姨，我实在是不愿说，可贩毒是种卑鄙的营生。

definition: to scrape a meager living/to get by with difficulty
variant of 糊口[hu2 kou3]
handicraft/needlework/work
to seek one's livelihood/to work to support oneself/to earn a living
profession/role (acting)
to buy and sell/to do business/to trade/to deal
to eke out a living/to live from hand to mouth/to drift aimlessly
to support one's family (idiom); to have difficulty feeding a family
business/CL:筆|笔[bi3]
life force/vitality
to live one's life/to make a living
to support one's family (idiom)
livelihood
to make a living
to break into a house for robbery (idiom)
to make a hard living as unskilled laborer
to imitate the dog and steal chicken (idiom)/to pilfer/to dally with women/to have affairs
store/shop
